level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this chapter, the term:
"Legal custody" includes imprisonment, jail, or detention.
"Ward" means any person in the official custody of the District government, on a temporary or permanent basis, because of neglect, abuse, mental illness or intellectual disability.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 19-169, in par. (3), substituted "intellectual disability" for "mental retardation".

level.heading: Emergency Act Amendments

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: Law 13-172, the "Fiscal Year 2001 Budget Support Act of 2000," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-679, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 18, 2000, and June 6, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 26, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-375 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-172 became effective on October 19, 2000.
For history of Law 19-169, see notes under § 4-114.
